definition: to cook on a slow fire/to extract by heating/to decoct/to endure

sentences.english: The feeling of guilt gnawed at my conscience day and night.
sentences.chinese: 忸捏日夜熬煎着我的良心。

sentences.english: I tortured you for 32 years, and I can"t forgive myself."
sentences.chinese: 我熬煎了你32年，我没有办法谅解自己。

sentences.english: Such day life will do, the person killing.
sentences.chinese: 这样的日子过一生又会怎样，把人都熬煎死了。

sentences.english: Don't waste your time and energy languishing in a state of need.
sentences.chinese: 不要把时间和精力浪费和熬煎在期盼上。

sentences.english: When you love someone, even torture is also a kind of happiness.
sentences.chinese: 当你爱一小我地时分，连熬煎也是种幸福。

sentences.english: He couldn't distress her with his own terrible dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 他不能用自己糟糕的困境来熬煎她。

sentences.english: He is a tortured soul, and most in need of your love.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个备受熬煎的魂灵，最需要你的爱。

definition: torture/corporal punishment (traditionally involving mutilation or amputation)
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
to suffer enough from/to suffer all kinds of/to have one's fill of
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
